question.answer: EPiServer CMS is an information platform that allows you to quickly and easily publish information on a web site without the need for any specific knowledge of creating web pages.
Page templates are .aspx pages that are displayed to visitors and contain the functionality required to perform specific function.
Page types are forms in which the editor can enter information in EPiServer CMS.
View mode is the display vistors see
Edit mode is the view seen by editors when they log on to create or update information on the web site.
Admin mode is the mode in which system administrators can create and modify the settings for the web site.
The publish button is displayed when you have access rights to publish the page and it publishes the page straight to live site.
The ready to publish is used if you dont have sufficent access rights to publish the page.

There are three different ways to edit an existing page in EPiServer CMS. They are simple edit, quick edit and full edit. Simple edit allows on page editing, quick edit will open the page type only where as full edit will open complete editor window.
Save option is avaialble on the top of editor window. It is useful if you are working on a page for a long time.
Save and option is avaialble on the top of editor window. It is useful if you want to view the page before publishing.
Save and publish is avaialble on the top of editor window. It is useful if you want to publish the current pages to the live site.

You can copy pages using copy button in the toolbar. Highlight the page you want to copy and click copy button on toolbar. Select the page where you want to copy and the select paste button on toolbar. You can also use right click on the selected page.

Select the page which you like to delete and click delete button on toolbar. You can also use the right click option on the selected page.

Right click the image you want to edit and click image properties to open image editor and change image display size.

It is possible to configure what css-files the editor, as well as the XForm editor loads and uses. This can be configured in two ways.
1. As a property on the page. This property can be either a dynamic or a standard page property. The property needs to be named UIEditorCssPaths and in the form of a comma separated list of paths to the stylesheets. Setting this in page or dynamic properties will override the correlating setting in Web.config. 2. As a setting in Web.config. If no property is set the fallback will be to use the setting uiEditorCssPaths in web.config. This setting is also in the form of a comma separated list of paths to the stylesheets. The web.config setting will be used if no property on the page is set to point out alternative stylesheets.
Sample of a comma-separated css-path list:
"~/Templates/Public/Styles/Glossy/Editor.css, ~/Templates/Public/Styles/Glossy/Editor2.css".

1. Select Add new item in the solution explorer context menu. 2. Select the EPiServer node. 3. Select the Page item and enter a name for the new template. 4. Click OK. 5. A confirmation box will prompt you whether to create a new EPiServer Page Type for the new page template or not. 1. If you choose to add a corresponding page type, you will be prompted with a new dialog asking for some more information about the page type. After completing this, the files will be created and a new entry will be added to the page type table in the contained database. 2. If you select not to add a page type, the page template files will simply be created.

1. Select Add new item in the solution explorer context menu. 2. Select Web User Control. 3. Enter a name for the control to create. 4. Click OK. 5. The generated files should have the correct filename (for example: foo.ascx, foo.ascx.cs, foo.ascx.designer.cs). 6. The type defined in the code behind file should have a name based on the provided filename and be placed in the default namespace for the current project location. 7. The type declared in the codebehind file should derive from EPiServer.UserControlBase.

The controls shipped with the latest EPiServer release are built and designed with ease of use in mind. There should be very little need of adding your own code behind to these classes as they are intended to be used in markup rather than coded against or inherited from.
If you do need additional functionality we recommend that you inherit from the GenericDataSource control and create your own classes that suit your needs.
In web.config , change membership's defaultProvider="WindowsMembershipProvider" to defaultProvider="MultiplexingMembershipProvider"
In web.config , change role provider's defaultProvider="WindowsRoleProvider" to defaultProvider="MultiplexingRoleProvider"
